result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ennis Lee Howard Jr

records.addlTxt: Filed: Original Transcript of Preliminary Hearing ( 9 pages) commencing 08-26-2022 by Danielle N. Holcomb.

Defendant Ennis Lee Howard Jr not in court, in custody.  Attorney Sylvan Jaspen in court for Ennis Lee Howard Jr.  Attorney Patrick O'Keefe in court for State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests a status date.  Court set date as requested. This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties. This hearing may be streamed live on Dacast at the Court's discretion:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/a8cc2343-9b62-c309-778f-fa846faecb6a.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.
Status conference scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Ennis Lee Howard Jr appeared by video, in custody in HOC.  Attorney Amanda Poznanski appeared by video for Attorney Sylvan Jaspen. Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded. Court took judicial notice of case #19CF4562. Sworn for the State: MPD Officer E. Maldonado. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Ennis Lee Howard in court with attorney Amanda Poznanski.  Defendant Ennis Lee Howard in custody.  Arthur Kenneth Thexton appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Ennis Lee Howard appeared by video means with Attorney. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Ennis Lee Howard Jr
Current: 1755 N 17th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53206   (Effective: 08-16-2022)
Prior: 1725 West Center Street, Milwaukee, WI 53206
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
